pullRequest.title: E2E Github Action workflow for minikube
pullRequest.bodyText:
Move Integration tests from CircleCI to Github Actions.
We have been running integration tests on Github Actions in Eclipse JKube and they seem very stable when compared to CircleCi. Let's move them here to see if it's actually CI which is the reason for flaky tests or whether it's actually our test code.

nodes.bodyText:
Hopefully this part won't be needed.
This is only needed in JKube because we run parallel tests with different base images and OpenShift won't start Pods if the 80% free space threshold is surpassed.
This step adds an overhead of ~4 minutes in average to the workflow. If we get Disk pressure in this project too, we should try to use lighter images to perform our tests or other approaches (this should be our last resort).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,102 @@
+#
+# Copyright (C) 2015 Red Hat, Inc.
+#
+# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+# You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#         http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+# limitations under the License.
+#
+
+name: E2E Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master
+  pull_request:
+  schedule:
+    - cron: '0 1 * * *' # Everyday at 1
+
+env:
+  IT_REVISION: master
+  IT_DIR: kubernetes-itests
+
+jobs:
+  minikube:
+    name: K8S
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        kubernetes: [v1.18.3,v1.12.0]
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Setup Minikube-Kubernetes
+        uses: manusa/actions-setup-minikube@v1.0.2
+        with:
+          minikube version: v1.9.2
+          kubernetes version: ${{ matrix.kubernetes }}
+          github token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
+      - name: Setup Java 11
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: '11'
+      - name: Install Kubernetes Client
+        run: mvn -f pom.xml -B -DskipTests clean install
+      - name: Install and Run Integration Tests
+        run: |
+          cd $IT_DIR
+          mvn test -Dtest="io.fabric8.kubernetes.**"
+  openshift:
+    name: OpenShift
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        openshift: [v3.11.0,v3.10.0]
+    steps:
+      - name: Free up Space
+        run: |
+          sudo apt list --installed
+          sudo apt-get purge -y                     \
+            'aspnetcore.*'                          \
+            'cabal-install.*'                       \
+            'clang.*'                               \
+            'dotnet.*'                              \
+            'firefox.*'                             \
+            'ghc.*'                                 \
+            'google-chrome.*'                       \
+            'heroku.*'                              \
+            'libmagic.*'                            \
+            'libmono.*'                             \
+            'mono-.*'                               \
+            'mysql.*'                               \
+            'php.*'                                 \
+            'ruby.*'
+          sudo apt-get autoremove
+          df -h

commit.message: E2E Github Action workflow for minikube

beforeCommit.message:
Make test execution serial by forced serial execution

Earlier we were creating and deleting resources @Before and @After executing
every test, which seems redundant and resource intensive task too. We can synchronize
execution of tests so that they make use of output generated in intermediate steps rather
than creating everything from scratch

afterCommit.message:
Make test execution serial by forced serial execution

Earlier we were creating and deleting resources @Before and @After executing
every test, which seems redundant and resource intensive task too. We can synchronize
execution of tests so that they make use of output generated in intermediate steps rather
than creating everything from scratch

afterCommit.message:
Prepare test environments in @BeforeClass rather than @Before

Earlier we were creating and deleting resources @Before and @After executing
every test, which seems redundant and resource intensive task too. I discussed this
with @manusa and we agreed on shifting this logic to @BeforeClass which would be
executed once for each test class.
